results.name: Number of solutions to Sum_{k=1..n} k*c(k) = n! , c(k) > 0.
comment: a(n) is the number of partitions of n! - n*(n+1)/2 into parts that are at most n. - _Alois P. Heinz_, Feb 08 2014
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..31
A. V. Sills and D. Zeilberger, Formulae for the number of partitions of n into at most m parts (using the quasi-polynomial ansatz) (arXiv:1108.4391 [math.CO])
results.author: _Wouter Meeussen_, Feb 08 2014
